alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Sharp (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 10:27AM CST until February 11 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arkansas... Spring River At Hardy affecting Fulton and Sharp Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Spring River At Hardy. * WHEN...From this morning to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water is breaking out of the banks and flooding low lying areas along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 3.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Spring River Hardy 10.0 3.8 Wed 10 AM 9.5 5.7 4.1 9.5 12 PM 2/09 &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
